Raven.synopsis: You talk to a Raven in the shadow-cursed lands. Part of the Servant of the Raven booster.
Raven.how_to_trigger: Go to 57.167; 50.995; 173.108 and click on the Raven, or cast speak with animals and then click on it.

AD_TakingTurn_001_Combat.synopsis: Combat ADs for the Shadar Kai. Says one line at the start orf each of his turns.

AD_TakingTurn_003_Combat.synopsis: Combat ADs for the Shadar Kai. Says one line at the start orf each of his turns.

Memories.synopsis: The player has delivered Madeline's ledger to He Who Was. The shadar-kai uses the book to channel her spirit. Player can punish her, making her stab herself the way her friends died, verbally admonish her, or forgive her.
Memories.how_to_trigger: Teleport to shadarkai, 1,1,1 the quest. Teleport to Harperledger, pick it up and return to shadarkai.

AD_Idle.synopsis: An idle AD playing from time to time after the ritual. This gives hints that He Who Was and the raven are not actually supposed to be in the shadowlands.
AD_Idle.how_to_trigger: Trigger the ShadarKai's auto-started dialog, after - this AD will play from time to time.

Raven_AD_GoBack.synopsis: A brief AD ment to remind the player to go back to shadar kai.
Raven_AD_GoBack.how_to_trigger: The raven appears once the player leaves the brewery with the ledger.

ShadarKai.synopsis: You talk to a shadar-kai from the shadowfell. He tasks you with collecting memories from the dead.
ShadarKai.how_to_trigger: Go to 106.70, 52.50, 104.66 and the dialog will auto-start.

Raven_AD_Bye.synopsis: A concluding AD by the Raven when players completed the quest, before Raven disappears.
Raven_AD_Bye.how_to_trigger: Find the ledger and complete the quest without making Shadar Kai hostile.

Madeline_SwD.synopsis: Short SWD with Madeline, Question Limit already reached because the shadar kai has been talking to her already when players approach.
Madeline_SwD.how_to_trigger: Cast SWD on Madeline corpse at 125; 54; 106

AD_TakingTurn_002_Combat.synopsis: Combat ADs for the Shadar Kai. Says one line at the start orf each of his turns.

Raven_9.speaker: Narrator
Raven_9.text: *The raven looks at you with cold, dead eyes.*

Raven_5.speaker: Player
Raven_5.text: I am friend to all, little raven. There is no need to be cruel.

Raven_6.speaker: Raven
Raven_6.text: You think the creatures of the realm owe you something just because you never shut up.
Raven_6.context: NodeContext: biting and vicious, she's incredibly cruel

Raven_0.speaker: Raven
Raven_0.text: They whisper about you, you know. Call you stupid and ignorant. They wish you were dead! Hah!
Raven_0.context: NodeContext: gearing up, delighting in ripping the player a new one. Maniacal laugh at the end

Raven_12.speaker: Raven
Raven_12.text: You're disgusting. Ugly. Loathsome. You should just shut up and die.
Raven_12.context: NodeContext: biting and vicious, she's incredibly cruel

Raven_19.speaker: Raven
Raven_19.text: Lies. You'll die alone, you know.
Raven_19.context: NodeContext: biting and vicious, she's incredibly cruel

Raven_17.speaker: Player
Raven_17.text: You're a loathsome little bird, aren't you?

Raven_3.speaker: Raven
Raven_3.text: True. But people will miss me when I'm gone.
Raven_3.context: NodeContext: biting and vicious, she's incredibly cruel

Raven_8.speaker: Raven
Raven_8.text: No one will miss you when you die. They'll piss on your grave. Hah!
Raven_8.context: NodeContext: gearing up, delighting in ripping the player a new one. Maniacal laugh at the end

Raven_23.speaker: Player
Raven_23.text: Not as much as I hate myself.

Raven_18.speaker: Raven
Raven_18.text: Good. You should hate yourself - you're vicious and evil and cruel. Everyone who loves you will suffer and die!
Raven_18.context: NodeContext: biting and vicious, she's incredibly cruel

Raven_20.speaker: Raven
Raven_20.text: Slitting your own throat would be a kindness. HAH!
Raven_20.context: NodeContext: gearing up, delighting in ripping the player a new one. Maniacal laugh at the end

Raven_24.speaker: Raven
Raven_24.context: NodeContext: biting and vicious, she's incredibly cruel

Raven_1.speaker: Narrator
Raven_1.text: *There is a malevolence in this bird - rooted deep. It would not be wise to touch it.*

Raven_2.speaker: Narrator
Raven_2.text: *You notice nothing out of the ordinary.*

Raven_26.speaker: Raven
Raven_26.context: CinematicNodeContext: close up of player's hand reaching out, and raven flapping wings and pecking, hand pulls away quickly

AD_TakingTurn_003_Combat_0.speaker: He Who Was
AD_TakingTurn_003_Combat_0.text: You have been judged - and found wanting.

Memories_135.speaker: Player
Memories_135.text: What do I need to do?

Memories_85.speaker: He Who Was
Memories_85.text: I seek a record of this one's crimes - a ledger written in her own hand. With it, I can summon her spirit - and force her to face trial.

Memories_130.speaker: Player
Memories_130.text: What do you get out of it?

Memories_94.speaker: He Who Was
Memories_94.text: The joy of bringing suffering to the unpunished. Her victims deserve closure, and the ledger is key.

Memories_188.speaker: He Who Was
Memories_188.text: Go to the distillery, the one she calls The Waning Moon. Find it - and bring it to me.

Memories_159.speaker: He Who Was
Memories_159.text: And together, we shall mete out justice long overdue.

Memories_98.speaker: Player
Memories_98.text: No - I don't have time for this.

Memories_26.speaker: He Who Was
Memories_26.text: Madeline's spirit is within reach. It is time to make her face trial, to make her suffer.
Memories_26.context: NodeContext: cold, cruel and with a touch of glee at the end

Memories_53.speaker: He Who Was
Memories_53.text: Alas, Madeline has fled, and not even my powers can force her to return. I no longer require you.

Memories_66.speaker: He Who Was
Memories_66.text: The raven's-favoured returns. What have you brought?

Memories_196.speaker: He Who Was
Memories_196.text: The ledger lies in The Waning Moon. Retrieve it, or this murderer will go unpunished.

Memories_124.speaker: He Who Was
Memories_124.text: This one is a murderer who walks free. She deserves to be punished. Or will you deny her victims peace?
Memories_124.context: NodeContext: cold and calculated, trying to manipulate the playeer

Memories_76.speaker: Player
Memories_76.text: Fine. What do I have to do?

Memories_187.speaker: He Who Was
Memories_187.text: Your soul is lit with a grace few possess. It is... blinding.
Memories_187.context: NodeContext: trying to manipulate the player with a compliment, he doesn't really mean this

Memories_82.speaker: Player
Memories_82.text: No. I don't have time for this.

Memories_104.speaker: He Who Was
Memories_104.text: You have denied her victims any chance of rest. I pray you sleep easy at night.
Memories_104.context: NodeContext: cold and calculated, trying to manipulate the player (totally does not hope the player sleeps easy)

Memories_126.speaker: He Who Was
Memories_126.text: The air stirs in trepidation - you have the ledger.

Memories_6.speaker: Player
Memories_6.text: Tell me why you want it first.

Memories_27.speaker: He Who Was
Memories_27.text: To punish a murderer. If that is not enough, leave. I have no time for those lacking commitment.
Memories_27.context: NodeContext: cold, but a touch of irritation at the end. He wants the ledger, and he doesn't like being made to wait.

Memories_112.speaker: He Who Was
Memories_112.text: We have it - her lies, her guilt. Madeline reported her friends to a Dark Justiciar and fled when they were butchered.
Memories_112.context: NodeContext: a touch of excitement begins to creep into the usually cold tone. Cruel smile.

Memories_161.speaker: He Who Was
Memories_161.text: Well, she flees no more. I will be the conduit for Madeline's spirit. I will force her to face trial.
Memories_161.context: NodeContext: a touch of excitement begins to creep into the usually cold tone. Cruel smile.

Memories_37.speaker: He Who Was
Memories_37.text: And you will be the judge. Make her beg, make her suffer.
Memories_37.context: NodeContext: a touch of excitement begins to creep into the usually cold tone. Cruel smile.

Memories_160.speaker: Player
Memories_160.text: I'm here to make sure she sees justice.

Memories_101.speaker: He Who Was
Memories_101.text: There is no justice for traitors - only pain.

Memories_59.speaker: Player
Memories_59.text: Let's see what she has to say first.

Memories_41.speaker: He Who Was
Memories_41.text: Careful - for a serpent in life is a serpent in death.

Memories_176.speaker: Player
Memories_176.text: I'm going to punish her - throughly.

Memories_185.speaker: Player
Memories_185.text: I'd like to hear her story first - I imagine it's quite the tale.

Memories_10.speaker: Player
Memories_10.text: When punishment is needed, my hand will not shy from the blade.

Memories_11.speaker: He Who Was
Memories_11.text: The raven was right, we were fated to meet. Break her, my friend - most thoroughly.
Memories_11.context: NodeContext: pleased the player agrees with him, thinks they are of one mind and both enjoy cruelty

Memories_103.speaker: He Who Was
Memories_103.context: CinematicNodeContext: Eyes roll back in his head as he looks up - body jerkingNodeContext: low, excited voice. Eyes roll back in his head as he looks up - body jerking. Falls to his knees.

Memories_19.speaker: Madeline
Memories_19.text: You! He said I was gonna be punished, that you'd be the judge. But I didn't mean to hurt anyone!
Memories_19.context: NodeContext: on her knees, sees player - terrified. Stands up.

Memories_156.speaker: Player
Memories_156.text: Why don't you tell me what happened?

Memories_151.speaker: Player
Memories_151.text: You 'didn't mean' to kill your friends? How laughable.

Memories_71.speaker: Astarion
Memories_71.text: Well now, let's not throwing stones. Glass houses and all that.

Memories_154.speaker: Wyll
Memories_154.text: Not as if you can relate to the killing urge, can you? Hmph - I can taste the hypocrisy from here.

Memories_102.speaker: Gale
Memories_102.text: Come now - you're hardly in position to cast judgement on that score, are you?

Memories_113.speaker: Lae'zel
Memories_113.text: Yes - how laughable. You're above such things as the killing urge.

Memories_95.speaker: Madeline
Memories_95.text: I said it didn't mean nothin', that Ben n' Marc were just drunk n' whining.
Memories_95.context: NodeContext: quietly horrified as she remembers what comes next

Memories_200.speaker: Madeline
Memories_200.text: The Dark Justiciar promised she was gonna chat with 'em. She promised.
Memories_200.context: NodeContext: quietly horrified as she remembers what comes next

Memories_30.speaker: Player
Memories_30.text: What did the Dark Justiciar actually do to your friends?

Memories_79.speaker: Madeline
Memories_79.text: She gave 'em a dagger each, and told 'em to press it against their stomachs.
Memories_79.context: NodeContext: traumatised and horrified. This is the worst thing that she's ever seen

Memories_122.speaker: Madeline
Memories_122.text: On the count of three, to 'start stabbin', and not to stop 'til she said so.
Memories_122.context: NodeContext: traumatised and horrified. This is the worst thing that she's ever seen

Memories_115.speaker: Madeline
Memories_115.text: She never said stop. I'd do anything to take it back. Anything.
Memories_115.context: NodeContext: eyes closed at memory, voice breaking at the horror. Nearly crying

Memories_105.speaker: Player
Memories_105.text: I once ended one dear to me. There is no punishment which could atone for it.

Memories_174.speaker: Madeline
Memories_174.text: You did? But how - how do you live with yourself?
Memories_174.context: NodeContext: really hoping the player will give her hope, give her some way to survive with this guilt

Memories_93.speaker: Player
Memories_93.text: I don't - not really. The image haunts me, leaving me more dead than alive.

Memories_83.speaker: Madeline
Memories_83.text: I should have known - there's no forgiveness for people like us.

Memories_109.speaker: Player
Memories_109.text: I try to do better by the living.

Memories_181.speaker: Madeline
Memories_181.text: But I'm dead. I can't do better. Not any more.

Memories_32.speaker: Player
Memories_32.text: Life runs through our fingers like falling rain, nothing we can do.

Memories_47.speaker: Madeline
Memories_47.text: I should have known - there's no hope for me.

Memories_190.speaker: Player
Memories_190.text: I killed my darling for sport, and I enjoyed it.

Memories_42.speaker: Madeline
Memories_42.text: I might be a monster, but at least I regret it.

Memories_164.speaker: Player
Memories_164.text: Anything? Then hurt yourself as Ben and Marc did - stab yourself.

Memories_58.speaker: Madeline
Memories_58.context: CinematicNodeContext: Draws a blade form behind and holds it out in front of her, blade pointed towards her stomach.NodeContext: Madeline draws a blade from behind her and holds it in front of her stomach, blade pointed towards her stomach. She is utterly terrified (pose like seppuku)

Memories_50.speaker: Player
Memories_50.text: Start stabbing, and don't stop until I say so.

Memories_16.speaker: Madeline
Memories_16.context: CinematicNodeContext: Stabs herself on the Ah! and then pulls out the knifeNodeContext: Ah! is a noise of pain as she stabs herself in the stomach and then pulls out the knife. 'I'm sorry' is said in clear pain.

Memories_175.speaker: Madeline
Memories_175.context: CinematicNodeContext: Stabs herself on the Argh! and then pulls out the knifeNodeContext: stabs herself again on 'Argh', noise of pain. I'm so so sorry is half crying as she's in agony.

Memories_54.speaker: Player
Memories_54.text: Did I say stop? Drive the knife in deeper.

Memories_189.speaker: Madeline
Memories_189.context: CinematicNodeContext: Stabs herself after 'I'm' and then pulls out the knifeNodeContext: Grunt of pain after 'I'm' as she stabs herself herself again. knife remains in her left hand as she drops her arm to the side. Sorry is half faded, almost like she's dying from the pain (the shadar kai is about to take over her body)

Memories_43.speaker: He Who Was
Memories_43.context: NodeContext: Holding knife just about his stomach, as if about to stab himself when he says the line. Roar of absolute fury and pain from the shadar kai as he takes back control. Knife stays in his left hand and moves to his side.

Memories_3.speaker: He Who Was
Memories_3.text: ARGH! You vile sadist, what have you done to me?
Memories_3.context: CinematicNodeContext: Knife is in his right hand. He drops it.NodeContext: Blinking and shaking as he regains control of his body. Absolutey furious and in pain.

Memories_207.speaker: Madeline
Memories_207.context: NodeContext: Knife is poised above her stomach and she relaxes, letting the knife remain in her left hand as that arm drifts to the side. Other hand touches her stomach and then she looks at player. In clear pain, voice fading as if she's dying (shadar kai is about to take over her body)

Memories_186.speaker: He Who Was
Memories_186.text: That was genius, my friend. You have broken her in ways I could not have imagined.
Memories_186.context: CinematicNodeContext: Knife is in his right hand. He drops it.NodeContext: Breath laugh at the beginning and exitement in first sentence. Bloodied knife in his left hand, which he drops. He's shaking, blinking as he takes back control of his body. Returning to calm cold and calculated by end of second line. Cruel smile.

Memories_67.speaker: He Who Was
Memories_67.text: Though I'd have preferred not bleeding quite so profusely.
Memories_67.context: NodeContext: wry sarcasm as he looks over his bleeding body, does not seem bothered by the pain

Memories_150.speaker: Player
Memories_150.text: What? You said to punish her!

Memories_191.speaker: He Who Was
Memories_191.text: Not to the point of killing this body!

Memories_89.speaker: He Who Was
Memories_89.text: You will join me in the darkness of oblivion, you treacherous insect!
Memories_89.context: NodeContext: furious and murderous - about to start combat

Memories_100.speaker: He Who Was
Memories_100.text: I suppose it is on me for not being more specific. But Madeline suffered, that is all that matters.
Memories_100.context: NodeContext: sarcasm on first line, cold and cruel on the last

Memories_92.speaker: He Who Was
Memories_92.text: You have done well. Her pain and anguish were sublime - I will treasure it.

Memories_13.speaker: He Who Was
Memories_13.text: Here - for your services. However, a friendly warning - be careful, or you may be the next murderer I bring to justice.

Memories_1.speaker: He Who Was
Memories_1.text: Here - for your services. Should I find another murderer in need of torment, I shall call upon you. Farewell.

Memories_193.speaker: Player
Memories_193.text: That was fun - can I do it again?

Memories_65.speaker: He Who Was
Memories_65.text: You dare mock me as I near bleed to death?

Memories_145.speaker: He Who Was
Memories_145.text: Not until I have recovered, if you wouldn't mind.

Memories_61.speaker: He Who Was
Memories_61.text: I am the one bleeding out and near death.

Memories_31.speaker: He Who Was
Memories_31.text: You were the one who forced her to relive the death of her friends - nicely done.

Memories_165.speaker: Player
Memories_165.text: Prove you're sorry. Do it for Ben and Marc.

Memories_51.speaker: Player
Memories_51.text: Stop. You were willing to hurt yourself - that is enough for me.

Memories_62.speaker: Madeline
Memories_62.context: CinematicNodeContext: Drops the knife after realising she's forgivenNodeContext: Knife poised abover her stomach, she drops it. Voice flooded with relief and gratitude.

Memories_152.speaker: Madeline
Memories_152.context: NodeContext: a smile as her eyes roll back in her head, smile on her face (shadar-kai is about to take over her body)

Memories_99.speaker: He Who Was
Memories_99.text: Argh. You were supposed to make her suffer! Not forgive her.
Memories_99.context: NodeContext: He stumbles a little in place as her returns to his body with a jerk. He's utterly furious, vicious and cruel

Memories_23.speaker: Player
Memories_23.text: What happened wasn't her fault - she deserved forgiveness.

Memories_114.speaker: He Who Was
Memories_114.text: That doesn't matter! I seek the guilty. The tormented. The anguished.
Memories_114.context: NodeContext: this is the most riled up we ever see him (usually cold and calculated)

Memories_74.speaker: He Who Was
Memories_74.text: You have crossed me, and for that, I end your pathetic life.
Memories_74.context: NodeContext: Begins combat after this line, absolute furious

Memories_107.speaker: Player
Memories_107.text: Do not speak to me like that.

Memories_149.speaker: He Who Was
Memories_149.text: You're right, now is not the time for talk.
Memories_149.context: NodeContext: cold and threatening, preparing to enter combat

Memories_198.speaker: Player
Memories_198.text: You whine more than she did.

Memories_215.speaker: He Who Was
Memories_215.text: I thought us of one mind, I see now I was wrong.
Memories_215.context: NodeContext: cold and threatening, preparing to enter combat

Memories_69.speaker: Player
Memories_69.text: You could have fought back. You deserve no forgiveness, COWARD!

Memories_209.speaker: Player
Memories_209.text: Yours is a classic tale of cowardice. Were you a character in a tale of mine, I would kill you off - immediately.

Memories_44.speaker: Player
Memories_44.text: You had the means to stop it - you chose not to. You let fear and cowardice rule you.

Memories_24.speaker: Madeline
Memories_24.text: You're right. I'm a killer. A monster.

Memories_91.speaker: Madeline
Memories_91.context: NodeContext: voice fading as her eyes roll back in her head, shadar-kai is about to take over. This should be a heartbreaking moment - lots of grief and sorrow

Memories_20.speaker: He Who Was
Memories_20.text: Ah! Glorious. Look - my hand still shakes.
Memories_20.context: NodeContext: returns to his body with a jerk, smiling as he looks at his hand.. Breathy with excitement like he's on a high

Memories_80.speaker: He Who Was
Memories_80.text: You broke her - most thoroughly. Well done.
Memories_80.context: NodeContext: delighted and cruel smile, little breathy as he comes down from the high. Collected and cold by 'well done'

Memories_177.speaker: Player
Memories_177.text: This was just some perverted fantasy of yours, wasn't it?

Memories_111.speaker: He Who Was
Memories_111.text: Perhaps, but we both got what we wanted, didn't we?

Memories_81.speaker: He Who Was
Memories_81.text: You did not harm her as much as I had hoped, but your work was adequate, as will be your reward.

Memories_8.speaker: Player
Memories_8.text: She was punished - that's all that matters.

Memories_139.speaker: He Who Was
Memories_139.text: If you are satisfied, than so am I.

Memories_132.speaker: He Who Was
Memories_132.text: It is pleasing to see we are of one mind.
Memories_132.context: NodeContext: cruel smile, he believes him and the player to both we weirdo perverts

Memories_179.speaker: Narrator
Memories_179.text: *Overwrought with grief, the connection begins to fade.*

Memories_194.speaker: Madeline
Memories_194.text: I'm sorry, Ben... I'm sorry, Marc... I'm so...
Memories_194.context: NodeContext: voice fading as her eyes roll back in her hea, shadar-kai is about to take over

Memories_121.speaker: He Who Was
Memories_121.text: Ah! A pity - she fades. Her pain was such that even I could not tether her for long.
Memories_121.context: NodeContext: returns to his body with a jerk, Dissapointed

Memories_52.speaker: He Who Was
Memories_52.text: Still, her grief was most potent. It will satiate me for a time.
Memories_52.context: NodeContext: a shrug, he still had a good time and that's all that matters. Cruel smile

Memories_128.speaker: Player
Memories_128.text: Pathetic - you murdered your friends. You're a coward.

Memories_48.speaker: Player
Memories_48.text: Forgiveness comes from within - I cannot gift it to you. But know that I would, if I could.

Memories_55.speaker: Player
Memories_55.text: When I tell this tale, you won't be the villain - I promise. The Dark Justiciar is to blame.

Memories_7.speaker: Player
Memories_7.text: There's nothing you need do. This wasn't your fault - I promise.

Memories_157.speaker: Madeline
Memories_157.text: What I did was wrong - and I won't ever forgive myself.
Memories_157.context: NodeContext: player has forgiven her. Madeline is still angry with herself, but there is a quiet gratitude here as she process that a single person in the world doesn't hate her - and how grateful she is for that.

Memories_144.speaker: Madeline
Memories_144.text: But hearin' that just one person doesn't hate me. That one person forgives me, makes the load so much lighter.
Memories_144.context: NodeContext: surprise and immense gratitutude. This is the kindest someone has been to her in a long time. Sad smile.

Memories_136.speaker: Player
Memories_136.text: By the light of the one I serve, I forgive you. This wasn't your doing.

Memories_208.speaker: Player
Memories_208.text: Stab yourself. Rip your stomach open. Feel the pain of your friends - only then will you be free.

Memories_168.speaker: Player
Memories_168.text: If it was drunk complaining, why did you report them?

Memories_172.speaker: Madeline
Memories_172.text: The Dark Justiciar said to report everythin', big or small. She ain't the type you say no to.

Memories_73.speaker: Player
Memories_73.text: Don't blame others for what you did.

Memories_146.speaker: Madeline
Memories_146.text: You didn't see it. Didn't see what the Dark Justiciar did.

Memories_171.speaker: Player
Memories_171.text: My gorge rises at your sickening naivety.

Memories_60.speaker: Madeline
Memories_60.text: No - no that wasn't the worst of it.

Memories_143.speaker: Shadowheart
Memories_143.text: Oh, come on now - it happens to the best of us, from time to time.

Memories_77.speaker: Player
Memories_77.text: Peace - speak your truth. We will go from there.

Memories_88.speaker: Player
Memories_88.text: Blood taints all our hands in ways we never predict.

Memories_14.speaker: Madeline
Memories_14.text: But - but this wasn't supposed to happen - I swear!

Memories_64.speaker: Player
Memories_64.text: It's all right, I'm not here to judge you.

Memories_197.speaker: Madeline
Memories_197.text: You're - you're not? But he said I deserved it. That I'm... evil.
Memories_197.context: NodeContext: surprised, madeline thinks she's a piece of shit. Sad and downcast

Memories_210.speaker: He Who Was
Memories_210.text: What's this? The ledger is gone - how curious. Without it, the ceremony is an impossibility.
Memories_210.context: NodeContext: Patting down his 'pockets' like he's looking for something. Irritated. 'how curious' glares at player with a clear accusation (the player stole the ledger)

Memories_17.speaker: He Who Was
Memories_17.text: A pity. Should I find another murderer in need of torment, I will find you. Until then, farewell.

Memories_211.speaker: Player
Memories_211.text: I am here in the honour of justice and order - that is all.

Memories_35.speaker: He Who Was
Memories_35.text: Then steel your heart - for this woman is a serpent who wears many faces. Do not be fooled.

Memories_38.speaker: Player
Memories_38.text: I know how to break people - don't you worry.

Memories_204.speaker: He Who Was
Memories_204.text: You break their bones, my friend - a curable malady. I need you to leave her very soul broken and useless.

Memories_192.speaker: Player
Memories_192.text: She won't know her own name by the time I'm done with her.

Memories_142.speaker: Player
Memories_142.text: Perhaps I will finish what the Dark Justiciars started.

Memories_217.speaker: He Who Was
Memories_217.text: I thought I the teacher. But I have a feeling I will learn much from you.
Memories_217.context: NodeContext: cruel smile at the thought of madeline's pain

Memories_129.speaker: Player
Memories_129.text: I think I'll just kill you instead.

Memories_137.speaker: He Who Was
Memories_137.text: A pity, I thought you smarter than this. Come.
Memories_137.context: NodeContext: A cold smile, about to begin combat, planning to murder player

Memories_108.speaker: Player
Memories_108.text: How do you know I have the ledger?

Memories_214.speaker: He Who Was
Memories_214.text: The raven was right about you. Your name will be remembered.
Memories_214.context: NodeContext: this sounds like it could be either a threat or a compliment depending on how you look at it. Cruel smile

AD_Idle_0.speaker: He Who Was
AD_Idle_0.text: The murderer's body is gone - and with it, any change of justice.

AD_Idle_3.speaker: He Who Was
AD_Idle_3.text: You are right. There are others in need of judgement - let us find them.

AD_Idle_4.speaker: He Who Was
AD_Idle_4.text: If you do not approve, you can leave.

AD_Idle_8.speaker: Raven
AD_Idle_8.context: NodeContext: this is a raven mimicking human speech (look it up on youtube, it's cool and freaky!). Emotionaless and freaky. Getting louder and louder.

AD_Idle_7.speaker: He Who Was
AD_Idle_7.text: We are fortunate to have found a companion.
AD_Idle_7.context: NodeContext: discussing the player. Sounds a little sinister

AD_Idle_1.speaker: Raven
AD_Idle_1.context: NodeContext: this is a raven mimicking human speech (look it up on youtube, it's cool and freaky!). Emotionaless and freaky. Getting louder and louder.

AD_Idle_2.speaker: He Who Was
AD_Idle_2.text: Be at ease. None could ever replace you.
AD_Idle_2.context: NodeContext: speaking to the raven, sincere. He would be lost without his companion raven.

AD_Idle_11.speaker: Raven
AD_Idle_11.context: NodeContext: this is a raven mimicking human speech (look it up on youtube, it's cool and freaky!). Emotionaless and freaky. A loud bark.

AD_Idle_9.speaker: He Who Was
AD_Idle_9.text: No. Not until we've dealt with Madeline.

AD_Idle_15.speaker: He Who Was
AD_Idle_15.text: Do not look at me like that.

AD_Idle_12.speaker: He Who Was
AD_Idle_12.text: Our orders do not matter. We make our own destiny now.

Raven_AD_GoBack_0.speaker: Raven
Raven_AD_GoBack_0.text: You found the ledger? Guess you're not so useless. Get back to master, on the double!

Raven_AD_GoBack_1.speaker: Raven
Raven_AD_GoBack_1.context: InternalNodeContext: Since it's AD, use of PETPAL is challanging.NodeContext: this is a raven mimicking human speech (look it up on youtube, it's cool and freaky!). Emotinaless and stilted with a squawk at the end.

ShadarKai_81.speaker: He Who Was
ShadarKai_81.context: CinematicNodeContext: Using SWD on the corpse of a dwarf. NodeContext: Shadar-Kai speaks in a cold, calculated tone.

ShadarKai_65.speaker: Madeline
ShadarKai_65.context: CinematicNodeContext: Corpse CollapsesNodeContext: Speak with dead style

ShadarKai_29.speaker: He Who Was
ShadarKai_29.text: You walk in the darkness, unafraid? How curious.

ShadarKai_49.speaker: Player
ShadarKai_49.text: Playing with the dead, are we? How charming.

ShadarKai_44.speaker: He Who Was
ShadarKai_44.text: Indeed. One whose secrets are not for your ears. Be on your way.

ShadarKai_71.speaker: Player
ShadarKai_71.text: Were you just talking to a corpse?

ShadarKai_66.speaker: Player
ShadarKai_66.text: I've met few who can also commune with the dead.

ShadarKai_13.speaker: He Who Was
ShadarKai_13.text: And I have met few who stand so tall and fearless in the face of the unknown. Be on your way, brave soul.
ShadarKai_13.context: CinematicNodeContext: Addressed to player, gestures to bodyNodeContext: talking about yourself

ShadarKai_43.speaker: He Who Was
ShadarKai_43.text: A fair point - perhaps this one could assist us.

ShadarKai_3.speaker: He Who Was
ShadarKai_3.text: The murdered lie silent. The raven asks - will you be their voice?

ShadarKai_74.speaker: Narrator
ShadarKai_74.text: *The raven, the piercings, the general malaise: this is a shadar-kai. Tales and songs featuring servants of the Raven Queen tend to be tragedies.*

ShadarKai_45.speaker: He Who Was
ShadarKai_45.text: She is not the victim. Nay, she is the perpetrator.

ShadarKai_69.speaker: Player
ShadarKai_69.text: Speak plainly - what are you talking about?

ShadarKai_31.speaker: He Who Was
ShadarKai_31.text: Forgive me - it has been some time since I spoke to another.

ShadarKai_6.speaker: Player
ShadarKai_6.text: Why does the raven want to know?

ShadarKai_61.speaker: He Who Was
ShadarKai_61.text: He thinks you strong enough for the task at hand.

ShadarKai_73.speaker: Player
ShadarKai_73.text: I will always seek justice for the wronged.

ShadarKai_42.speaker: He Who Was
ShadarKai_42.text: Then you and I were fated to meet.

ShadarKai_51.speaker: Player
ShadarKai_51.text: Death often comes for a reason. I've killed before, does that make me a murderer?

ShadarKai_22.speaker: He Who Was
ShadarKai_22.text: Depends. Did those you kill trust you? Care for you?
ShadarKai_22.context: NodeContext: player says 'I've killed before, does that make me a murderer?'

ShadarKai_84.speaker: He Who Was
ShadarKai_84.text: This woman tended a bar where she took her patrons, her friends, into her confidence - promised their secrets were safe with her.

ShadarKai_30.speaker: He Who Was
ShadarKai_30.text: Yet she turned their words into knives - and stabbed them in the back.

ShadarKai_1.speaker: He Who Was
ShadarKai_1.text: They died because of her - and to this day her victims lie unavenged.

ShadarKai_17.speaker: Player
ShadarKai_17.text: She's dead - how much more can she pay?

ShadarKai_62.speaker: He Who Was
ShadarKai_62.text: Death is not the end - merely another beginning.

ShadarKai_26.speaker: Player
ShadarKai_26.text: Her soul has departed for the Fugue Plane, to be judged or lost forever. What more could she pay?

ShadarKai_79.speaker: He Who Was
ShadarKai_79.text: The Fugue Plane is no obstacle to one such as I.

ShadarKai_58.speaker: Player
ShadarKai_58.text: I doubt you're here out of the goodness of your heart.

ShadarKai_21.speaker: Player
ShadarKai_21.text: What good is murder if it isn't done in the name of the divine? It would be an honour to punish her.

ShadarKai_11.speaker: He Who Was
ShadarKai_11.text: You see it as I do.

ShadarKai_16.speaker: He Who Was
ShadarKai_16.text: I seek a record of this one's crimes - written in her own hand.

ShadarKai_56.speaker: He Who Was
ShadarKai_56.text: Through it, I can summon her spirit - and force her to face trial for her crimes.

ShadarKai_15.speaker: He Who Was
ShadarKai_15.text: My reasons are of no consequence.

ShadarKai_59.speaker: Player
ShadarKai_59.text: That's some powerful magic - how do you do it? Can you show me?

ShadarKai_4.speaker: He Who Was
ShadarKai_4.text: Such spells are ancient secrets, and closely guarded - but I could be convinced to share them with an ally.
ShadarKai_4.context: NodeContext: a smile - he knows he has the player (he's lying)

ShadarKai_50.speaker: He Who Was
ShadarKai_50.text: Your soul sparks with vengeance. With fury. This is your chance to torment a murderer. To make her suffer.
ShadarKai_50.context: NodeContext: his big pitch - determined, passionate, a touch zealous

ShadarKai_33.speaker: He Who Was
ShadarKai_33.text: Your soul sparks with justice. With fortitude. This is your chance to bring a murderer to justice. To avenge her victims.
ShadarKai_33.context: NodeContext: his big pitch - determined, passionate, a touch zealous

ShadarKai_20.speaker: He Who Was
ShadarKai_20.text: Not for one such as I.

ShadarKai_52.speaker: Player
ShadarKai_52.text: What do you need me to do?

ShadarKai_77.speaker: Player
ShadarKai_77.text: Hardly a fair trial - you've already decided her guilt. Why?

ShadarKai_5.speaker: Player
ShadarKai_5.text: I will - what must I do?

ShadarKai_12.speaker: He Who Was
ShadarKai_12.text: I thank you - as do those who died by her words.

ShadarKai_70.speaker: He Who Was
ShadarKai_70.text: Go to the distillery, the one she calls The Waning Moon. Find the ledger - and bring it to me.
ShadarKai_70.context: NodeContext: [GL] set for rerecord, original read was too angry. Please listen to proceeding lines for tone level

ShadarKai_82.speaker: Player
ShadarKai_82.text: So long as I get paid.

ShadarKai_23.speaker: He Who Was
ShadarKai_23.text: The death of heroism is close, I see.

ShadarKai_67.speaker: He Who Was
ShadarKai_67.text: A pity - I thought I sensed the spark of heroes in you.

ShadarKai_36.speaker: Player
ShadarKai_36.text: You are not an impartial judge. Why have you decided her guilt already?

ShadarKai_9.speaker: Player
ShadarKai_9.text: Kill the dead. Kill the killed dead. Kill the killed dead again and again.

ShadarKai_2.speaker: Narrator
ShadarKai_2.text: *Your mind swoons with possibilities, this blessed loon may murder the same soul as many times as he wishes.*

ShadarKai_40.speaker: He Who Was
ShadarKai_40.text: No. I seek only justice - not murderous deviancy.

ShadarKai_27.speaker: He Who Was
ShadarKai_27.text: I offer you a chance to avenge this murderer's victims. Will you take it?

ShadarKai_76.speaker: Player
ShadarKai_76.text: It sounds like she must be punished - thoroughly.

ShadarKai_24.speaker: Player
ShadarKai_24.text: Then we should seek revenge on her behalf.

ShadarKai_34.speaker: Player
ShadarKai_34.text: It is an honour to meet one of the Raven Queen's scions. What brings you here?

ShadarKai_32.speaker: He Who Was
ShadarKai_32.text: For your kind to know Her ways is rare. You will suit the task at hand well.

ShadarKai_0.speaker: Player
ShadarKai_0.text: Not many people out here in the darkness.

ShadarKai_25.speaker: He Who Was
ShadarKai_25.text: I am not 'people'. Though many would question how wise it is to approach a stranger in the dark. Be on your way.

ShadarKai_63.speaker: Player
ShadarKai_63.text: That spell - Speak With Dead, correct? Your technique is impeccable.

ShadarKai_46.speaker: He Who Was
ShadarKai_46.text: When you have lived as long as I, such simple magic becomes second nature.

ShadarKai_18.speaker: Player
ShadarKai_18.text: You look tough - good. It's more fun that way.

ShadarKai_72.speaker: He Who Was
ShadarKai_72.text: Stay your hand, and be on your way. I'll not raise mine against you.

Raven_AD_Bye_0.speaker: Raven
Raven_AD_Bye_0.text: I'd say bye, but you'll be dead soon! Hah!
Raven_AD_Bye_0.context: NodeContext: cruel and vicious, big laugh at the end

Raven_AD_Bye_1.speaker: Raven
Raven_AD_Bye_1.context: NodeContext: this is a raven mimicking human speech (look it up on youtube, it's cool and freaky!). Emotionaless and freaky. Getting louder and louder.

Madeline_SwD_0.speaker: Narrator
Madeline_SwD_0.text: *The corpse does not stir. It will answer no more questions.*
